notes:
2.2.1.WSI.021
All the contracted projects (45) have finished their construction. 
No more projects will be constructed due to lack of feasibility, 23 out of 68 projects were not feasible. There were 5 criteria for the selected projects in order to be built: 1) technical feasibility, 2) legal feasibility, 3) economic feasibility, 4) social feasibility, and 5) environmental feasibility.
The reasons for not building the projects are due to lack of Technical Feasibility: in 5 projects the water was not sufficient to supply the community; and in 6 additional projects the level of arsenic was found to be higher than the admitted amounts. Another reason for not building the projects, is due to lack of Economic Feasibility: in 3 projects the mayors did not give counterpart funding; 4 additional projects did not meet the cost-benefit assessment due to low quantity of beneficiaries. And additional reason  for not building the project is due to lack of Social Feasibility: in 5 projects households did not accept to be connected to the water meter.
